prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Trés Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Trés Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Trés Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Trés Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Trés Bien on Dec. 3rd. Click here for details. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Trés Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Trés Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. Click here for details. X = victim's seat.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints. Facing the cup, one can see a lip stain on the front, and a floral looking handle to the right.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Trés Bien. The bag is empty.
There was a prescription bag on the victim's table along with the lottery ticket.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Trés Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The crime was reported at 2:25 PM by a kind of scary old man, sir.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: Poor Maggey had passed out from the shock. It must've been real tough for her.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: The victim didn't have any identification on him.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: But we figured out who he was pretty quick, and then the investigation went smoothly.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: When Maggey was searched, we found the lottery ticket and the bottle of poison.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 5
Testimony: And that was it. There was nothing else missing from the crime scene.
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 2 (Magazine Clipping) states that I was trounced and my client was found guilty, implying that Maggey was found guilty of murder. However, Character 4 (Maggey Byrde) description says she "Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me," suggesting that Maggey's conviction was due to a manipulation or deception involving a false version of me. This could imply some doubt about the legitimacy of her conviction.

Testimony 4 by Gumshoe states that when Maggey was searched, they found the lottery ticket and bottle of poison, supporting that Maggey was directly involved in the crime with physical evidence linking her.

These two pieces of information don’t necessarily contradict. I need to find a pair where the evidence or testimony conflict directly.

Consider Evidence 14 (Victim's Lottery Ticket) found during the body search of Maggey, indicating she had possession of the victim's winning lottery ticket, which suggests a motive.

Testimony 5 by Gumshoe says: "And that was it. There was nothing else missing from the crime scene," implying that nothing was missing from the crime scene besides the items found on Maggey.

Evidence 2 says the client was found guilty, which aligns with Maggey being found guilty.

Now consider Evidence 6: Small Bottle found in the kitchen, the victim's ear medicine, covered with Furio Tigre's fingerprints.

If Furio Tigre's fingerprint is on the bottle that had the poison, this points towards his involvement.

Testimony 0 says the crime was reported at 2:25 PM by a scary old man.

Look at Evidence 10: Glen's Autopsy Report says time of death 1:30 to 2:30 PM.

If the crime was reported at 2:25 PM but death time overlaps 1:30-2:30 PM, possibly conflicting with someone’s testimony.

However, no testimony gives a more exact time of death.

Look at Evidence 13: Coffee Cup with potassium cyanide, covered in victim and Maggey's fingerprints. Lip stain on the front.

Testimony 18 by Victor Kudo: He says "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."

But Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) shows intact vase on each table, indicating he might be lying.

This is contradictory: Victor's testimony says he broke a vase, the crime photo shows all vases are intact.

Therefore, Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) contradicts Testimony 18 (Victor's Testimony).

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The young man was reading the sports paper.
Person: Kudo
Testimony 1
Testimony: The serving girl brought him a javaccino... But she put something in it!
Person: Kudo
Testimony 2
Testimony: There's no question about it! She very conspicuously put some white powder in there.
Person: Kudo
Testimony 3
Testimony: The man took one sip of it, looked like he was in terrible pain, and then collapsed.
Person: Kudo
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's the serving girl, right there in the defendant's chair. I remember her well!
Person: Kudo
Testimony 5
Testimony: There was a ribbon in her hair, and her apron's straps were loose.
Person: Kudo
Testimony 6
Testimony: There wasn't anything that caught my interest about her when I saw her from the front.
Person: Kudo

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 13 (Coffee Cup) shows that the coffee contained potassium cyanide and has fingerprints of the victim and Maggey, suggesting that Maggey was involved in poisoning the victim. However, Testimony 6 by Victor Kudo states, "There wasn't anything that caught my interest about her when I saw her from the front," implying that he did not notice anything unusual about the serving girl (Maggey) at the time. This contrasts with Testimony 1 and 2 where Kudo accuses the serving girl of putting something in the javaccino.

This contradiction lies between the concrete proof that Maggey handled the poisoned coffee and Kudo's ambiguous observation of her, seeming to downplay her unusual behavior.

Upon reconsideration, a stronger direct contradiction is between:

Evidence 16 (Potassium Cyanide) which has Maggey's fingerprints, indicating she handled the poison, and

Testimony 5 (Kudo) mentions, "There was a ribbon in her hair, and her apron's straps were loose," which is used to identify the serving girl who put poison. 

But this is not necessarily a contradiction but more of a description.

A clearer contradiction would be:

Evidence 14 (Victim's Lottery Ticket) was found on Maggey during a body search (implying possession),

Whereas Testimony 4 by Kudo: "That's the serving girl, right there in the defendant's chair. I remember her well!" but Testimony 6: "There wasn't anything that caught my interest about her when I saw her from the front." Possibly contradictory but again weak.

The best direct contradiction is between:

Evidence 6 (Small Bottle) found in the kitchen, which is the victim's ear medicine, covered with Furio Tigre's fingerprints, suggesting he was in the kitchen, possibly involved.

Whereas Testimony 18 (Victor's Testimony): "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry," indicating he was seated and did not move.

But that involves different persons.

The clearest direct contradiction is between:

Evidence 13 (Coffee cup) says the coffee contained potassium cyanide and had victim and Maggey's fingerprints on it, showing that Maggey poisoned the coffee.

Testimony 6 by Victor Kudo: "There wasn't anything that caught my interest about her when I saw her from the front."

Kudo's first testimonies (1 and 2) claim the serving girl distinctly put something in the coffee.

Thus, no direct contradiction there.

Another contradiction is between:

Evidence 14 (Victim's Lottery Ticket) found on Maggey, implying she stole or had it.

And Testimony 4 by Kudo says, "That's the serving girl, right there in the defendant's chair. I remember her well!" implying she was identified as the perpetrator.

No contradiction here.

Therefore, the contradiction is between:

Evidence 6 (Small Bottle - victim’s ear medicine found with Furio Tigre's fingerprints) indicating Furio was in the kitchen

Versus Testimony 18 (Victor's Testimony) which doesn't mention Furio or anyone else in the kitchen, only Victor breaking the vase at his seat.

But this is weak.

Given the above, the strongest single contradiction is:

Evidence 13 (Coffee Cup) with Maggey's fingerprints shows poisoning.

Testimony 6 (Victor) says nothing of interest about her, contradicting Kudo's other claims about the girl putting poison.

But this is not a direct contradiction between evidence and testimony.

Alternatively, Evidence 16 (Potassium Cyanide) bears Maggey's fingerprints.

Testimony 6 says nothing suspicious about her.

So there is a contradiction in Kudo's testimony.

Hence, the requested pair is Evidence 16 and Testimony 6.

Person: Kudo
Testimony 1
Testimony: He had a newspaper in his right hand, and the noisy brat kept rustling its pages!
Person: Kudo
Testimony 2
Testimony: The young man was listening to the wireless. I remember that well.
Person: Kudo
Testimony 3
Testimony: Then the serving girl in question brought over the javaccino.
Person: Kudo
Testimony 4
Testimony: The little fidget picked up the cup with his free hand and took a sip.
Person: Kudo

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 13 states that the victim's coffee cup, which contained potassium cyanide, had a lip stain on the front, indicating that the victim drank from it. It also states that the victim had the newspaper in his right hand.

Testimony 4 by Kudo says "The little fidget picked up the cup with his free hand and took a sip." This implies the victim held the coffee cup in the hand opposite to the one holding the newspaper. Since the victim had the newspaper in his right hand (Evidence 13), the "free hand" would be the left hand.

If the victim held the cup with their left hand and the newspaper with their right, it is consistent. But if the testimony said the "free hand" took a sip, it means the victim's left hand (the free one) held the cup. This aligns correctly.

Therefore, no contradiction there.

Now, check the position of the coffee cup from evidence and testimonies about the victim's hand. Evidence 13 says the coffee cup's handle is to the right side (floral handle to the right). If the victim picked up cup with free hand, which is the left hand, the cup would be handle left, because the victim would naturally pick it up by the handle. But evidence says handle is on right, which suggests the cup was ready for right hand pick up. This mismatches.

So evidence 13 indicates cup handle to the right side, but testimony 4 says the victim took a sip with their free hand (left hand), meaning the cup should be handle left for natural grasping.

Hence, the contradiction is between Evidence 13 and Testimony 4.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 18 (Victor's Testimony): "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry." clearly states that Victor broke the vase at his seat.

Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) description says: "There is an intact vase on each table."

This contradicts Victor's testimony because Victor claims to have broken the vase, but the photo evidence shows the vases are intact. Thus, Victor's testimony that he broke the vase contradicts the photographic evidence.
